sourceOfFunds.purpose: ENVIRONMENT AWARENESS CAMP:- Delhi in a city in which un –authorisedcolories, constructions, jhuggi jhopari clusters have been mushrooming at a faster rate in which neither roads, drainage systems nor public conveniences are available. Accumulation of dirty water, use of open spaces for public conveniences throwing of wastes on roads/ sheets /open spaces, throwing of dead animals in open area are major problems which have degraded the environment.

WOMEN AND FAMILY WELFARE PROGRAMME: The women awareness camp Trust by the Pavitra Education Trust. The eligible couples were motivated to adopt the ways to control the birth rate. They were also advised to maintain a small family with two children and to have a gap in the birth of two children. They were also appraised to use condoms and oral pills to control the pregnancy. The females were also advised to have a regular check up during pregnancy, take deliveries in hospitals and to provide pro

YOUTH ACTIVITY The power of today and tomorrow “The youth” have been motivated to participate and contribute there in the integration to the nation building. They have been after called through formal meeting and seminar to express their views and ideas and many cultural programmers have been conducted buy the organization based on national them and harmony. We have the rare distraction of conducting such a camp at Delhi for the fires time after the independence of the country.

ROAD SAFETY AWARENESS : India is the country in which development has been observed in all respect including transport. The population of the country has been increasing at a faster rate, which has been affecting the demand in all sectors including the transport. The road development has also been taken up simultaneously. The development if taken in positive is good but in negative way it creates so many problems: LaxmiNagar is one of the Town in which development has taken place very fast.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The activities of PIDT are divided into 5 major heads. These are:1) Awareness Generation, Education and Training for Transformation - Peoples Institute for Development and Training (PIDT) conducts A, B and C level (class III, V and VIII) examinations under the National Institute of Open Schooling (NIOS) and runs formal Anandalaya Public School. 2) Sustainable Ecology through Environmental Regeneration, Health and Nutrition- PIDT Lokshala, Jagdishpur, District Deoghar conducts anganwadi workers and anganwadi sahaikas training. Homeopathy and ayurvedic clinics are run. The villagers are being asked to plant herbal plants for household remedies. Drinking water sources are treated with bleaching powder. Women are encouraged to take up kitchen gardening for better nutrition for self and the family. Ambulance service takes critical patients to nearby hospitals. A number of women have taken hand pump mechanic training and are repairing village hand pumps when they go out of order. In Deoghar, Jharkhand and Surguja, Chhattisgarh PIDT is working among the tribals for their upliftment through formation of their Village Development Committees (VDCs) and Self-Help Groups (SHGs), has made efforts to protect forest wealth and at the same time helped them preserve their culture and traditions. 3) Protection and Regeneration of Cultural Skills and Knowledge Systems - encouragement is being given to crafts, traditional skills and knowledge base of the rural communities and awareness is being generated about the cultural and gender issues to encourage womens groups for economic development. Anandalaya School of Music is imparting training in various forms of music. Effort is being made to preserve various art forms like traditional songs, dances and recipes. National and international days like International Volunteers Day (December 5), International Womens Day (March 8), Independence Day, Republic Day, Childrens Day etc are celebrated. 4) Self-Reliant Livelihood Enhancement - Village Development Committees (VDCs) in 3 PIDT regions have been converted into SHGs and they have become confident in the process of account-keeping, inter-lending and regular savings. They have taken up a number of income-generating activities. In all, 141 SHGs, most of them womens SHGs, have been formed. A significant number of them have received First, Second and Third grading. 5) Research and Advocacy for Peace, Femininity and Sustainability - Under this program, action research projects are taken up. For advocacy with the Government and policy-makers PIDT collaborates with like-minded organizations on issues like womens empowerment, education of the deprived sections of the society and social upliftment. It organizes programs on these issues and participates in the programs organized by other organizations nationally and internationally.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: â€œPERSONâ€ as a National- Level- Organization operating its diversified activities in 14 States of India PERSON today has branched out into performing various developmental activities that include provision of education, health, livelihood and skill up-gradation programme, addressing underprivileged youth and women living in slums and rural communities. As multi-disciplinary organization PERSON, focuses on deprived, marginalized and weaker sections of the society especially youth and women for their socio-economic rehabilitation through skill development / vocational training pragramme since 2001. The challenges of poverty, malnutrition, disease and health, unequal distribution of wealth , unfair sharing of resources , lack of opportunities reckons that rank of the poor are swelling. It is in above context Micro-credit and Micro-enterprise can play a very significant role in the alleviation of poverty. PERSON, therefore, changed its development strategy by incorporating creation of awareness, sensitisation, formation of self-help groups (SHGs) and mobilising of small savings by the poor for their development purposes.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: PHD Rural Development Foundation (PHDRDF) was formed under the aegis of the PHD Chamber of Commerce and Industry. For over three decades, PHDRDF has been proactively involved in the development of the less privileged and rural communities by implementing projects that contribute to their economic and social upliftment. The Foundation strives towards transforming the lives of people by creating opportunities and enhancing potential resources among the community members, enabling them to become self-reliant and aspire for a better tomorrow. PHDRDF works in priority areas through various projects and programs like health care initiatives (organize 100+ health camps per month), water harvesting (constructed 190+ water reservoir/ check dams), Training & Skill Development (conducted 20+ centers), Sanitation (constructed 100+ toilets), Education (Worked in around 25 government schools) and other need based community welfare activities. PHDRDF with its expertise has impacted lives of over 20 Lac people across 9 States with support of different Corporatesâ€™, Government organizations, PSUâ€™s and International organisations. PHDRDF also does research and consultation for various corporations in both the private and public sector by undertaking research services through development of CSR policy framework, baseline surveys, social impact assessment, CSR & sustainability reporting. PHDRDF has been awarded the â€œBest NGO for Revival of Rural Water Resourcesâ€ by Water Digest Awards 2013-2014. Ministry of Urban Development, Government of India, recognised work done by PHD Chamber of Commerce & Industry under the â€˜Swachh Bharat Abhiyanâ€™ (construction of toilets) by inviting us to include our work in the â€˜Swachh Bharatâ€™ Coffee Table Bookâ€™, recently launched by them. This book was released by the honourable President Shri. Pranab Mukherjee

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Plan to Empower is a non profit organization created with the aim to promote child welfare and womens right. We seek to safeguard the rights of women and children through advocacy, education, and empowerment. We work to ensure that families thrive in environments that are safe, healthy, nurturing, and productive. Women and children are the most vulnerable and disadvantaged constituents of most populations. We believe that the human rights and the wellbeing of women and children are inextricably linked and mutually reinforcing, and we recognize that the empowerment of women and children in particular can have a compelling ripple effect on entire communities

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Project Concern International/India (PCI/India), is a registered Charitable Society and is an affiliate of Project Concern International. Project Concern International is a non-profit health and humanitarian aid organization dedicated to enhance health, end hunger and overcome hardship. PCI mission is that the most vulnerable people in the world will have the power to lift themselves out of poverty and to create vital, healthy lives for their families and communities now and for the future. It is a leading international health organization with over 50 years of experience that saves the lives of children and families around the world by preventing disease and providing access to clean water and nutritious food. PCI reaches out to over three million people a year with programs in Africa, Asia, Latin America, and North America. PCI/India has been active since 1998. The India country office is located in New Delhi and has regional offices around the country. PCI/India has developed a diverse portfolio of programs in the areas of HIV/AIDS prevention, care and support; polio eradication; water and sanitation; humanitarian assistance, children at risk, skill development. PCI has skilled dedicated staff to achieve mission. FROM CONCERN TO RESULTS PCI/Indiaâ€™s current and recent accomplishments include: Around 1 million individuals reached directly and over 4 million individuals reached indirectly through community mobilization to improve MNCHS behaviors among women of reproductive age in most marginalized community; over .14 million individuals directly mobilized against polio and around 1 million were reached indirectly through various project activities; 0.22 million children immunized; 70,000 students reached for sanitation, hygiene and hand-washing; over 800 students were provided skill development training in various trades.
